turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Spock.
turn.2: On his homeworld, he was repeatedly bullied and tormented by full-blooded Vulcan children, who wished to incite the emotions of his human nature.
turn.4: For a time, he grew up alongside his older half-brother Sybok, until the older brother was cast out for rejecting logic.
turn.6: In the episode "Amok Time", it is revealed that Spock became betrothed to T'Pring (Arlene Martel) during his childhood.
turn.8: Sarek supported Spock's scientific learning and supporting his application to the Vulcan Science Academy, as mentioned in "Journey to Babel".
turn.9: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.10: In the 2009 film "Star Trek", Spock is seen rejecting his acceptance into the Vulcan Science Academy on the basis that they would never fully accept someone who was only half-Vulcan.
turn.12: Although this film set up the Kelvin timeline seen in this and later films, writer Roberto Orci stated that he felt that the actions were unaffected by the changes in this timeline and so would have occurred in the same manner prior to "The Original Series".
